page.title: 12INFANT SCHOOL CENTENARY
page.content: East Boldon Infant's School had its centenary on March 2nd 1985. The school celebrated with an exhibition of Victoriana,old maps of the village and old photographs in the school hall. A coffee morning organised by the PTA for pupils and ex-pupils was attended by almost 300 people. A thanksgiving service was held in St.George's Church on Sunday March 3rd. The children and staff dressed in Victorian costume.They had a birthday party and a cake with 100 candles. The school today has approximately 150 pupils in 6 classes.The classes are organised on an age basis,2 reception classes,2 classes of 5/6 year olds and 2 classes of 6/7 year olds. At the end of their three years in the infant school the children leave and move over to East Boldon Junior School.
